dt: {bc}the cavity of a tubular organ or part
{bc}the bore of a tube (as of a hollow needle or catheter)
{bc}a unit of luminous flux equal to the light emitted in a unit solid angle by a uniform point source of one candle intensity

et: New Latin {it}lumin-, lumen{/it}, from Latin, light, air shaft, opening
shortdef: the cavity of a tubular organ or part
the bore of a tube (as of a hollow needle or catheter)
a unit of luminous flux equal to the light emitted in a unit solid angle by a uniform point source of one candle intensity
